intro: Cyphostemma rivae, commonly known as the Rivale's moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in scrublands. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
